statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Christian Webster scored 18 points to lead six Harvard players in double figures in an 87-71 victory over Boston University on Saturday.
article.headline: Christian Webster, Harvard top BU to stay perfect at home
article.linkText: Webster, Harvard top BU, stay perfect at home
article.story: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- Christian Webster scored 18 points to lead six Harvard players in double figures in an 87-71 victory over Boston University on Saturday. Keith Wright had 17 points, Laurent Rivard 15, Andrew Van Nest 13, Oliver McNally 11 and Brandyn Curry 10 for the Crimson (7-2). Wright also had 10 rebounds. John Holland scored 21 points and Jake O'Brien 20 for the Terriers (4-7), who have lost their last four games. The game was tied seven times before a 12-0 burst gave Harvard a 55-43 lead with 13:20 remaining in the game. A pair of 3-pointers by Webster began and completed the run. The Crimson shot 71.4 percent (15 for 21) in the second half, including 6 of 10 from 3-point range. They also had a 40-28 rebounding advantage for the game. Harvard raced to a 10-2 lead in the opening 3:17, but Boston University battled back and the game was tied five times in the first half.
